name: 2,3,4-trinitro-toluene
Reason: 2,3,4-trinitro-toluene has a melting point that is influenced by several functional groups. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The nitro functional group (–NO2) raises the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and dipole-dipole interactions, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The toluene ring (C) adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The methyl group (–CH3) reduces the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around -5 degrees Celsius. The nitro group (–NO2) increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and dipole-dipole interactions, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The presence of three nitro groups significantly increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and dipole-dipole interactions. Each nitro group may contribute around +20 to +30°C.
